title: Victony
author: Victony
content: I recently purchased 0.0045 Bitcoins which is still present in my trust wallet I believe with me owning a fraction of the worlds Bitcoin although a very tiny fraction in practical I am now a crypto currency investor  in essence a Bitcoin investor

comments.author: woez
comments.body: The Fist, Congratulations on your recent Bitcoin purchase! By earning a fraction of Bitcoin, you have taken the step to become a cryptocurrency investor. As you mentioned, even though the amount you own may seem small, it is still part of the world's Bitcoin supply, making you part of the larger Bitcoin community. Becoming a Bitcoin investor requires a solid understanding of the cryptocurrency market, including its volatility, trends, and potential risks and growth opportunities. It is important to stay up to date with industry news and developments and have a clear investment strategy.While owning Bitcoin does not automatically make someone a skilled investor, I think this is a good start by means of continuing to educate yourself and staying informed about the market, you can make informed decisions about how to invest and grow your cryptocurrency portfolio.Good luck on your journey as a Bitcoin investor!

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Sure — but what's the big deal? I can also call myself an Apple investor by owning a fraction of Apple stock and I can also say I'm an investor in the top 500 US companies by holding an S&P500 ETF.Good for you for owning some BTC though.

comments.author: CageMabok
comments.body: Quote from: Victony on April 07, 2023, 06:07:26 AMI recently purchased 0.0045 Bitcoins which is still present in my trust wallet I believe with me owning a fraction of the worlds Bitcoin although a very tiny fraction in practical I am now a crypto currency investor  in essence a Bitcoin investor If you are a person who has just bought Bitcoin and kept it in your own trusted wallet, I will not consider you a Bitcoin investor as long as you don't use Bitcoin or invest it in a certain company. Because if you are only limited to buying and keeping in your wallet, you are not much different from Holders and also from traders who also try to save for a while before they sell it back to the market. So there's no need to consider yourself an investor if your effort is to save before selling again.

Still congratulations to OP for taking a step in Bitcoin.We don't have to be too strict with newbies, they still have a lot to learn, they already trusted and bought bitcoin, which is a great start. If we can't help them, don't get too upset with them.OP, congratulations, and welcome aboard with us. I know you are newbies and will have much work to do to make a profit. But what I can ask you to consider before that is about keeping your bitcoins safe. You say you are storing bitcoins on Trust wallet, which is a non-custodial but closed source wallet, which is not good. I'm not saying it's not secure, but you need to have full control over your bitcoins, and that's safety, as well as the difference between bitcoin and a centralized asset. You can learn about Electrum wallet instead of Trust, which is the safest and best software wallet we have available today.

comments.author: Bananington
comments.body: Quote from: Victony on April 07, 2023, 06:07:26 AMI recently purchased 0.0045 Bitcoins which is still present in my trust wallet I believe with me owning a fraction of the worlds Bitcoin although a very tiny fraction in practical I am now a crypto currency investor  in essence a Bitcoin investor Congratulations on your purchase, You have taken the first most important step of becoming an investor which is first investing, be aware that being an investor in bitcoins is a role that comes with a lot of responsibilities and challenges. It is not an easy ride to profit, you must be prepared for the days when it will feel like your investment is being lost to the market, and an urge to pull out while you still can, prepare for the days where there will be emotional trauma and disturbance, you have to be prepared to commit to keeping and holding your bitcoins, just as you commit to increasing your investment in it, you have to be prepared to be someone who do proper research, reading and following up on the news so you will not be given false second hand information.

comments.author: KiaKia
comments.body: You should have been applauded if you had accumulated Bitcoin to some degree, like 0.1BTC at the very least? What do you think? Many newbies have the same dream as yours but bear market always ruin that dream.As you accumulate Bitcoin right now, you haven't made it far at all since this is your first purchase, how much further can you go? I don't want you to feel discouraged, but what you are doing right now is accumulating Bitcoin, have you made any progress yet? no, because you are just getting started, it's not going to be a smooth road. Also, I hope you invested money you are not going to be using for a long period. There is no shortcut to making money out of Bitcoin, for now, keep biting and storing Bitcoin, maybe when the numbers are right enough like the example I gave you then you can decide to show off, it's not necessary though, but it could be encouraging for newbies like yourself.
